item.title: Next Bitcoin Software Update Will Be First to Feature SegWit Code - CoinDesk
item.description:
Next Bitcoin Software Update Will Be First to Feature SegWit Code - CoinDesk

A forthcoming bitcoin software update will be the first to feature code that could be later activated and included as part of an effort to scale transaction capacity on the bitcoin blockchain.

item.title: The Dream of The DAO Stubbornly Lives On - CoinDesk
item.description:
The Dream of The DAO Stubbornly Lives On - CoinDesk

There was a palpable distance onstage as discussion turned to The DAO. At this week's Blockchain NY conference, the founder of a startup that forked the ethereum blockchain to build its infrastructure and the co-creator of the decentralized application network itself sat as far from each other as they could while debating the now-infamous project.

item.title: Capital One Adds Veteran Blockchain Lawyer to FinTech Team - CoinDesk
item.description:
Capital One Adds Veteran Blockchain Lawyer to FinTech Team - CoinDesk

Veteran WilmerHale counsel Elijah Alper will join Capital One in September, where his responsibilities will include specializing in FinTech and blockchain. Alper has long been a notable voice in blockchain and digital currency industry, speaking out on pressing issues at industry events and authoring opinions in the developing subject area.

item.title: Bank of England Seeks Digital Currency Research Lead - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bank of England Seeks Digital Currency Research Lead - CoinDesk

The Bank of England is on the hunt for an economist to spearhead its research into a central bank-issued digital currency. According to the job listing, the research lead would play a driving role in its bid to issue a digitized, blockchain-based version of the UK pound - an idea the Bank of England has been exploring since as early as last year.

item.title: No, the EBA's Bitcoin Regulation Proposals Aren't All Bad - CoinDesk
item.description:
No, the EBA's Bitcoin Regulation Proposals Aren't All Bad - CoinDesk

Jacek Czarnecki is an attorney at Warsaw-based law firm Wardynski & Partners, where he specializes in areas including FinTech, digital currencies and blockchain. In this opinion piece, Czarnecki discusses recent proposals for EU digital currency regulation, arguing suggestions made by the European Banking Authority are more positive than they initially appeared.

item.title: Ethereum Classic is Starting to Mobilize - CoinDesk
item.description:
Ethereum Classic is Starting to Mobilize - CoinDesk

Ethereum's original blockchain just won't die. The result of a hard fork of the ethereum network in July, the blockchain has not only survived, but it's evolving into a competing version of the decentralized application platform. Now, supporters of the platform are beginning to mobilize.

item.title: Japanese Banks Plan Blockchain Currency Exchange - CoinDesk
item.description:
Japanese Banks Plan Blockchain Currency Exchange - CoinDesk

A group of Japanese financial institutions are looking to create a blockchain-based platform they could leverage to cut costs on domestic and foreign exchange services. Announced today, initial members include the Bank of Yokohama and SBI Sumishin Net Bank. Those involved in the effort will work with distributed ledger tech startup Ripple to develop the platform.

item.title: US Goverment Ready to Pass On DNS Control to ICANN
item.description:
US Goverment Ready to Pass On DNS Control to ICANN

The United States government has been managing the Domain Naming System -a key component of the Internet- for nearly 18 years, on October 1st, this responsibility will fall on ICANN's (Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers) shoulder. DNS system is responsible for the tracking and translation of human-readable names like TheMerkle.com or Google.com to an IP network address (comprised of numbers).

item.title: John McAfee Declares War On Kim Dotcom Over Megaupload 2.0
item.description:
John McAfee Declares War On Kim Dotcom Over Megaupload 2.0

After revealing that he was working on Megaupload 2.0, Kim Dotcom has stated his willingness to work with investors, however, things didn't go as planned after the -also- eccentric John Mcafee offered to invest in Dotcom's venture. A "twitter" war was unleashed after Kim Dotcom made public John Mcafee's attempts to invest in Megaupload 2.0.

item.title: Criminals Target Hospitals Through New Locky Ransomware Campaign
item.description:
Criminals Target Hospitals Through New Locky Ransomware Campaign

A new wave of ransomware attacks against hospital has begun. Internet criminals are distributing Locky ransomware on a vast scale, mostly in the form of phishing campaigns directed at the healthcare sector. The method of distribution is a macro-enabled Office 2007 Word document containing the malicious payload.
